translated: It is not proper for an intelligent person to abandon the statement of the Blessed One and accept the words of another foolish person, leaving aside what is endowed with reasoning and scripture.

original: āryaratnakūṭe ca sakaladānādikuśalopetatayā sarvākāravaropetaśūnyatā sevanīyetyuktaṃ na tu kevalā /
analyzed: ārya ratnakūṭe ca sakala dāna ādi kuśala upeta tayā sarva ākāra vara upeta śūnyatā sevanīyā iti uktam na tu kevalā
translated: And in the noble Ratnakūṭa, it is said that emptiness endowed with all the supreme aspects should be practiced by possessing all the virtues such as giving, and not just by itself.

original: āryaratnakūṭe coktam tadyathā kāśyapāmātyasaṃgṛhītā rājānaḥ sarvakāryāṇi kurvanti evam eva upāyakauśalyasaṃgṛhītā bodhisattvasya prajñā
analyzed: ārya ratnakūṭe ca uktam tat yathā kāśyapa amātya saṃgṛhītāḥ rājānaḥ sarva kāryāṇi kurvanti evam eva upāya kauśalya saṃgṛhītā bodhisattvasya prajñā
translated: And it is said in the noble Ratnakūṭa: “Just as, Kāśyapa, kings, being supported by ministers, perform all their duties, in the same way, the wisdom of a bodhisattva, being supported by skillful means,

analyzed: sarva buddha kāryāṇi karoti
translated: performs all the duties of a Buddha.

original: ata eva kevalāṃ śūnyatāṃ sevamānasya mā bhūnnirvāṇapraveśa iti /
analyzed: atas eva kevalām śūnyatām sevamānasya mā bhūt nirvāṇa praveśaḥ iti
translated: For this very reason, lest one who practices only emptiness enter into nirvāṇa,

analyzed: bhagavatā ārya tathāgataguhyasūtre ca uktam na ekānta nirālambanam cittamātra sevanam
translated: And it is said in the noble Tathāgataguhya Sūtra: “The mind alone, not attended with any object, is not one-sided.

original: kartavyam api tu upāyakauśalyam api sevanīyam iti pradarśanārtham uktam tadyathāpi nāma / kulaputra /
analyzed: kartavyam api tu upāya kauśalyam api sevanīyam iti pradarśana artham uktam tat yathā api nāma kula putra
translated: And it is said in the noble Tathāgataguhya Sūtra, in order to show that the mind should not be attended to as having only one aspect, which is non-objectification, but rather skill in means should also be attended to: “Just as, noble sir,

analyzed: agniḥ upādānāt jvalati
translated: fire burns with fuel,

analyzed: anupādānaḥ śāmyati
translated: but without fuel it goes out,

analyzed: evam eva ārambaṇataḥ cittam jvalati
translated: in the same way, the mind burns with an object,

analyzed: anārambaṇam śāmyati
translated: but without an object it goes out.

analyzed: tatra upāya kuśalaḥ bodhisattvaḥ prajñāpāramitā pariśuddha ārambaṇa upaśamam api jānāti
translated: There, the bodhisattva skilled in means knows the cessation of the object purified by the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: kuśala mūla ārambaṇam ca na śāmyati
translated: but does not cease the object of the roots of virtue.

analyzed: kleśa ārambaṇam ca na utthāpayati
translated: And he does not arouse the object of afflictions,

analyzed: pāramitā ārambaṇam ca utthāpayati
translated: but arouses the object of the perfections.

original: śūnyatārambaṇaṃ ca pratyavekṣate sarvasattvamahākaruṇārambaṇaṃ ca prekṣate iti hi kulaputra/
analyzed: śūnyatā ārambaṇam ca pratyavekṣate sarva sattva mahā karuṇā ārambaṇam ca prekṣate iti hi kula putra
translated: And he contemplates the object of emptiness, and looks at the object of great compassion for all beings. Thus, noble sir,

analyzed: upāya kuśalaḥ prajñāpāramitā pariśuddhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ na ārambane vaśitām pratilabhate
translated: the bodhisattva skilled in means, purified by the perfection of wisdom, attains mastery over the absence of objects.

original: iti vistaram uktvā punaśca vadatyevaṃ hi nāsti tat kiṃcid ārambaṇaṃ bodhisattvasya
analyzed: iti vistaram uktvā punar ca vadati evam hi nā asti tat kiṃcid ārambaṇam bodhisattvasya
translated: Having said this in detail, he further says: Thus there is nothing at all that is not established as an object for the bodhisattva

analyzed: yat sarvajña jñāna abhinirhārāya na saṃtiṣṭhate
translated: to accomplish omniscient knowledge.

analyzed: yasya bodhisattvasya sarva ārambāṇāni bodhi pariṇāmitāni
translated: For that bodhisattva, all objects are dedicated to enlightenment.

original: ayaṃ bodhisattva upāyakuśala sarvadharmān bodhyanugatān paśyati /
analyzed: ayam bodhisattvaḥ upāya kuśala sarva dharmān bodhi anugatān paśyati
translated: This bodhisattva, skilled in means, sees all dharmas as following enlightenment.

analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra
translated: Just as, noble sir,

original: nāsti tat trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau yat sattvānām upabhogāya na syāt /
analyzed: na asti tat tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau yat sattvānām upabhogāya na syāt
translated: there is nothing in the three-thousand great-thousand world that would not be for the enjoyment of beings,

original: Bhk evam eva / kulaputra nāsti tat kiṃcid ārambaṇaṃ yad upāyakuśalo bodhisattvo bodhāya copakārībhūtaṃ na paśyati iti vistaraḥ /
analyzed: evam eva kula putra na asti tat kiṃcid ārambaṇam yat upāya kuśalaḥ bodhisattvaḥ bodhāya ca upakārībhūtam na paśyati iti vistaraḥ
translated: in the same way, noble sir, there is nothing at all that is not seen by the bodhisattva skilled in means as being helpful for enlightenment. And so on in detail.

analyzed: evam ananta sūtrānteṣu bodhisattvānām prajñā upāya pratipattiḥ nirdiṣṭā
translated: Thus the practice of wisdom and means of the bodhisattvas is taught in many sūtras.

original: tatra yadi nāma svayaṃ na śakyate dānādidpuṇyasaṃbhāravīryam ārabdhuṃ tathāpi anyeṣām evam upadeśo dātuṃ na yuktaśceti svaparadrohaḥ kṛtaḥ
analyzed: tatra yadi nāma svayam na śakyate dāna ādi dpuṇya saṃbhāra vīryam ārabdhum tathā api anyeṣām evam upadeśaḥ dātum na yuktaḥ ca iti sva para drohaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: There, if one is not able oneself to undertake the effort of accumulating the merit of giving and so on, it is not right to give such advice to others. Thus one commits treachery against oneself and others.

original: tad evaṃ yuktyāgamābhyāṃ pratipāditaṃ yathā bodhisattvenāvaśyaṃ bhūtapratyavekṣā kartavyā sakaladānādipuṇyasambhāraścopārjayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: tat evam yukti āgamābhyām pratipāditam yathā bodhisattvena avaśyam bhūta pratyavekṣā kartavyā sakala dāna ādi puṇya sambhāraḥ ca upārjayitavyaḥ
translated: Thus, in this way, it has been shown by reasoning and scripture that a bodhisattva must necessarily investigate the truth and must accumulate all the merit of generosity and so forth.

analyzed: tatas prekṣāvatā alpa śrutānām ābhimānikānām vacanam viṣam iva avadhūya ārya nāgārjuna ādi vidvas jana vacana amṛta anugatena
translated: Then, the wise one should reject the words of those with little learning and pride, like poison, and follow the nectar-like words of learned people like Ārya Nāgārjuna and others.

analyzed: sakala sattveṣu mahā kāruṇām upajanayya māyākāra vat aviparyastena anuttara saṃbodhi pariṇāmita sakala dāna ādi kuśala caryāyām
translated: Having generated great compassion for all beings, like a magician, with an unperverted mind, in the practice of all wholesome deeds such as generosity, dedicated to unsurpassed complete enlightenment,

analyzed: aśeṣa jagat uddharaṇe ca abhiyuktne a bhāvitavyam
translated: and being engaged in the complete liberation of the entire world, one should meditate.

analyzed: yathā uktam ārya dharmasaṃgītau
translated: As it is said in the noble Dharmasangīti:

analyzed: māyākāraḥ yathā kaścid nirmitam moktum udyataḥ
translated: Just as a magician who is about to release a magical creation,

original: na cāsya nirmite saṅgo jñātapūrvo yato 'sya saḥ //
analyzed: na ca asya nirmite saṅgaḥ jñāta pūrvaḥ yatas saḥ
translated: has no attachment to that creation, because he knows it well.

analyzed: tri bhavam nirmita prakhyam jñātvā saṃbodhi pāragaḥ
translated: Knowing the three worlds to be like a magical creation, having attained complete enlightenment,

analyzed: sannahyanti jagat hetoḥ jñāta pūrve jage tathā
translated: they armor themselves for the sake of the world, knowing the world to be like that.

analyzed: iti tasya evam
translated: Thus, for him, it is like that.

original: prajñām upāyaṃ ca satataṃ satkṛtyābhyasyataḥ krameṇa cittaṃ saṃtatiparipākād uttarottaraviśuddhataratamakṣaṇodayād
analyzed: prajñām upāyam ca satatam satkṛtya abhyasyataḥ krameṇa cittam saṃtati paripākāt uttara uttara viśuddha taratama kṣaṇa udayāt
translated: For one who always honors and practices wisdom and means, the mind gradually, due to the maturation of the continuum, arises with increasingly pure moments.

analyzed: bhūta artha bhāvanā prakarṣa paryanta gamena sakala kalpanā jāla rahitam sphuṭataram dharmadhātu adhigamam
translated: By reaching the culmination of the practice of the true meaning, the realization of the dharmadhatu free from the entire net of conceptualization,

analyzed: vimalam niścala nivāta dīpa vat lokottara jñānam utpadyate
translated: the supramundane knowledge arises, clear, unmoving like a lamp in a windless place.

analyzed: tadā ca vastu paryanta tā ālambanam pratilabdham bhavati
translated: Then, the object-limit-support is attained.

analyzed: darśana mārgam ca praviṣṭaḥ bhavati
translated: And one enters the path of seeing.

original: prathamā ca bhūmiḥ prāptā bhavati /🔽tatastaduttarā bhūmīḥ pariśodhayan krameṇa kanakavad aśeṣāvaraṇāpagame sati asaktam apratihataṃ jñānaṃ pratilabhya buddhabhūmim aśeṣaguṇādhārāṃ
analyzed: prathamā ca bhūmiḥ prāptā bhavati  tatas tad uttarāḥ bhūmīḥ pariśodhayan krameṇa kanaka vat aśeṣa āvaraṇa apagame sati asaktam a pratihatam jñānam pratilabhya buddha bhūmim aśeṣa guṇa ādhārām
translated: And the first stage is attained.🔽Then, purifying the stages above that in sequence, like gold, when all obscurations are completely removed, one attains unobstructed and unattached knowledge, and

analyzed: prāptaḥ bhavati
translated: attains the stage of Buddhahood, the basis of all qualities.

analyzed: kārya pariniṣpattim ca ālambanam pratilabhate
translated: And one attains the support-limit-support.

original: tasmād buddhatvādhigamārthinā madhyamapaddhatau tāvad abhiyogaḥ karaṇīya iti /
analyzed: tasmāt buddhatva adhigama arthinā madhyama paddhatau tāvat abhiyogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, one who desires to attain Buddhahood should make effort in the Middle Way method.

analyzed: bhk
translated: BhK

original: prakāśya yat prāpi mayā śubham asamapaddhitam /
analyzed: prakāśya yat prāpi mayā śubham a sama pad hitam
translated: The auspicious and incomparable practice that I have attained,🔽

original: puṇyamastu janastena prāpto madhyamapaddhitam //🔽dūrīkṛterṣyādimalā hi santo guṇairatṛptāḥ salilairivābdhiḥ /
analyzed: puṇyam astu janaḥ tena prāptaḥ madhyama paddhitam  dūrīkṛta īrṣyā ādi malāḥ hi santaḥ guṇaiḥ atṛptāḥ salilaiḥ iva abdhiḥ
translated: The good that I have attained by revealing it, may that be the means for attaining the middle path by the people.🔽The good people, free from the impurities of jealousy etc., being insatiable with virtues like the ocean with water,

original: vivecya gṛṇhanti subhāṣitāni haṃsāḥ payo yatpayasi prahṛṣṭāḥ //
analyzed: vivecya gṛṇhanti subhāṣitāni haṃsāḥ payaḥ yad payasi prahṛṣṭāḥ
translated: select and recite the well-spoken words with delight, like swans taking the milk from water.

analyzed: pakṣapāta ākulam tasmāt dūrīkṛtam manaḥ budhaiḥ
translated: Therefore, the mind of the wise is free from the confusion of partiality.

analyzed: sarvam eva grahītavyam bālāt api subhāṣitam
translated: The well-spoken words should be accepted even from a child.

analyzed: ācārya kamala śīlena ante nibaddhaḥ bhāvanā kramaḥ samāptaḥ
translated: The Bhavanakrama composed by Acharya Kamalasila is completed.

analyzed: tṛtīyaḥ bhāvanā kramaḥ samāptaḥ
